messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] delaware, was Drum Corps International
messages.msgSnippet: Hey!  Wave on your way to Ocean City.. we live east of Salisbury. :-) Jolly Rogers has a couple of homeschooler days each summer. Interested? peace, susan ps
messages.messageBody:
Hey! Wave on your way to Ocean City.. we live east of Salisbury. :-)
Jolly Rogers has a couple of homeschooler days each summer. Interested?

peace,
susan

ps nice to know some of the unschoolers here are in the area! We only
know one other unschooling family here.

On Saturday, November 16, 2002, at 10:45 PM, Stephanie Elms wrote:

> Hi Christy! I live in Annandale, VA. About 20-30 mins outside
> Washington DC.
> Where in Delaware are you? We have a place in Ocean City and spend a
> good bit
> of time up there in the summer.
>
> How great to meet a fellow Hokie. I graduated in '91. My kids are
> almost 6
> and 2.5.
>
> Nice to meet you!
>
> Stephanie E.

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] delaware, was Drum Corps International
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Christy! I live in Annandale, VA. About 20-30 mins outside Washington DC. Where in Delaware are you? We have a place in Ocean City and spend a good bit of
messages.messageBody:
Hi Christy! I live in Annandale, VA. About 20-30 mins outside Washington DC.
Where in Delaware are you? We have a place in Ocean City and spend a good bit
of time up there in the summer.

How great to meet a fellow Hokie. I graduated in '91. My kids are almost 6
and 2.5.

Nice to meet you!

Stephanie E.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] delaware, was Drum Corps International
messages.msgSnippet: I live in Bear, just north of the canal.  My son is 3.  I would be interested in getting together and talking sometime.  I don t know any unschoolers around
messages.messageBody:
I live in Bear, just north of the canal. My son is 3. I would be interested in getting together and talking sometime. I don't know any unschoolers around here yet, the people I know who are homeschooling are into "doing school" at a set time everyday, etc.
It must have been someone else that said they met their husband at Virginia Tech.
Christy
susan marie <scribblers2@...> wrote:Hi neighbor! I live near Salisbury MD, a little further south on
Delmarva. We used to live in New Castle. (I'm a Univ of Del grad, hubby
grew up in Del and went to Salesianum.)

Where in Del. are you? I have two dd's, ages 12 and 8 and a 4 yo ds.

peace,
susan

On Friday, November 15, 2002, at 10:24 AM, Christine ONeal wrote:

>
> Do you live near Delaware? I live in Delaware and am just getting
> started with home schooling (my son is only 3, but interested in
> everything.) I also read that you went to Virginia Tech, I did too! I
> would love to talk sometime if you aren't too far away.
> Christy
> Stephanie Elms <stephanie.elms@...> wrote:My husband did
> this for 2 or 3 years in high school and loved it. When I found out
> about it I was really bummed that I only played clarinet. There is a
> corps up in Delaware
> that I hope is still around when the boys get older (I also hope that
> they are interested!).
> I love going to the shows...they have a small one at a local high
> school and we have
> taken Jason the last two years. He loved it (although he hates the open
> stands we had to
> sit in!).
>
> Two years ago the National Championships was held at the University of
> Maryland. Jeff and
> I went with Kyle who was only 5 months old (Jason was only 3 and would
> never have made it
> through all the corps). Kyle sat and nursed in the sling the whole time
> and managed to even fall asleep finally. We had such a good time....the
> music was awesome.
> Such power.
>
> Stephanie E.
>

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Drum Corps International
messages.msgSnippet: Do you live near Delaware?  I live in Delaware and am just getting started with home schooling (my son is only 3, but interested in everything.)  I also read
messages.messageBody:
Do you live near Delaware? I live in Delaware and am just getting started with home schooling (my son is only 3, but interested in everything.) I also read that you went to Virginia Tech, I did too! I would love to talk sometime if you aren't too far away.
Christy
Stephanie Elms <stephanie.elms@...> wrote:My husband did this for 2 or 3 years in high school and loved it. When I found out
about it I was really bummed that I only played clarinet. There is a corps up in Delaware
that I hope is still around when the boys get older (I also hope that they are interested!).
I love going to the shows...they have a small one at a local high school and we have
taken Jason the last two years. He loved it (although he hates the open stands we had to
sit in!).

Two years ago the National Championships was held at the University of Maryland. Jeff and
I went with Kyle who was only 5 months old (Jason was only 3 and would never have made it
through all the corps). Kyle sat and nursed in the sling the whole time
and managed to even fall asleep finally. We had such a good time....the music was awesome.
Such power.

Stephanie E.

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Drum Corps International
messages.msgSnippet: My husband did this for 2 or 3 years in high school and loved it. When I found out about it I was really bummed that I only played clarinet. There is a corps
messages.messageBody:
My husband did this for 2 or 3 years in high school and loved it. When I found out
about it I was really bummed that I only played clarinet. There is a corps up in Delaware
that I hope is still around when the boys get older (I also hope that they are interested!).
I love going to the shows...they have a small one at a local high school and we have
taken Jason the last two years. He loved it (although he hates the open stands we had to
sit in!).

Two years ago the National Championships was held at the University of Maryland. Jeff and
I went with Kyle who was only 5 months old (Jason was only 3 and would never have made it
through all the corps). Kyle sat and nursed in the sling the whole time
and managed to even fall asleep finally. We had such a good time....the music was awesome.
Such power.

Stephanie E.

messages.subject: Drum Corps International
messages.msgSnippet: Stephanie, I checked out their website just now. Dang! Too bad we re not still in CA, there seem to be lots of corps there. We re in No. Utah. Looks like a
messages.messageBody:
Stephanie, I checked out their website just now. Dang! Too bad we're
not still in CA, there seem to be lots of corps there. We're in No.
Utah. Looks like a really cool organization for anyone else who might
have interested teens.

Here's their site... http://www.dci.org

Beth
